result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DEVONTE J BROWN

records.addlTxt:
3:07 PM Defendant DEVONTE J BROWN in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for DEVONTE J BROWN.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with no repeater, with jail, fine, costs and DNA sample and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant requests more time to talk with his attorney. Court sets for plea & Sentencing on November 7, 2022 at 2:30 PM

Court adjourned at 3:13 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for DEVONTE J BROWN
Current: 1021 Moreland St, Oshkosh, WI 54902-6126 United States  (Effective: 09-20-2022)
Prior: 145 S Westhaven Dr Apt Q107, Oshkosh, WI 54901
Notice of Hearing for Plea/sentencing hearing set for November 1, 2022 at 2:00 PM has been returned. / Return to Sender. Brown Devonte J. 1021 Moreland St. Oshkosh Wi, 54902-6126        (forwarded)
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Return date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

4:25 PM Defendant DEVONTE J BROWN appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for DEVONTE J BROWN.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty kapelis. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 4:28 PM
Letter to Judge Slate from Atty Michael Kapelis dated 06/06/2022 re: request for defendant to appear via zoom due to a positive covid test      (NOTE: 06/06 approved by the court)
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on June 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

2:03 PM Defendant DEVONTE J BROWN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Michael Kapelis in court via zoom. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint, waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status  of Prelim on June 7, 2022 at 4:00 PM.

Court adjourned at 2:05 PM
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
